____ Republic

____ express

____ to ____

Actress ____ Jones

Called the best hot dog in New York (by Julia Child!):
____ King
Dr. Laszlo Kreizler of Caleb Carr's "The Alienist" is this type of professional tracking a killer in 1896
"Latte Trouble" & "On What Grounds" are 2 of Cleo Coyle's mysteries centered on one of these establishments
A fellow "tunnel rat" from this war may be the culprit LAPD detective Harry Bosch is looking for in "The Black Echo"
When a boy falls to his death, "Smilla's Sense of Snow" in this Scandinavian country helps prove it was murder
"A Morbid Taste for Bones" introduced this medieval monk solving a murder in a remote Welsh village
In 1980 3M introduced these, which you can use to leave messages & reminders all over the place
Brush your teeth regularly to remove this clear, sticky film before it hardens into tartar
This 1971 Rolling Stones album had a zipper on the front cover
The logo for this product shows a worker in a hard hat hanging from the letter A
Shipyards & pillows were good sources for the elements of this 2-part process used to punish & humiliate in colonial times
She's dominated the country & pop charts & in 2015, hit the dance one with "Style"; can her rap debut be far behind?
This poet who wrote, "For he on honey-dew hath fed, & drunk the milk of paradise" could say Taylor's my middle name
Jack C. Taylor lived long & prospered, starting this rent-a-car- co. with 7 vehicles in 1957
Canvas Converse All-Star sneakers bear the name of this man, an ex-hoopster turned shoe salesman
Richard E. Taylor's work confirming the existence of these subatomic particles upped his Q rating & won a 1990 Nobel
Steven Spielberg sank his teeth into this 1975 thriller, his first blockbuster
This not-at-all Christmasy film about demonic possession opened on December 26, 1973
In 1973, 43 years before they did it on HBO, robots roamed this title amusement park
It's this 1974 Jack Nicholson L.A.-set mystery, Jake
Bette Midler earned an Oscar nomination for this 1979 film in which she played a Janis Joplin-like rock star
In 1892 Edison's Light Company became this entity that is still a big deal today

Edison stiffed this man to the tune of $50,000 & told him, "When you become...American, you will appreciate an American joke"
Edison on this: "What a source of power! I hope we don't have to wait until oil & coal run out before we tackle that"
To discredit the A.C. power system, Edison tried to make this tycoon's name synonymous with electrocution

"Wayne's World" popularized this 3-letter interjection meaning "I don't really believe what I just said"

The first citation for "brewski" was when these aliens from "France" put them in trick-or-treat bags
The Rob-meister! The entry for "meister" credits this comedian & his "Copy-Machine Man" sketch
These people believed their god had told them to establish a new home & they did around 1325 in the valley of Mexico
A heroic stand against an invading army from this nation at 1862's Battle of Puebla is remembered every Cinco de Mayo

In 1853 Mexico sold territory south of the Gila River to the U.S. for $10 million in this acquisition
In 1810, in a sermon & early call for Mexican independence, Father Miguel Hidalgo issued the "Cry of" this town
This Wisconsin city celebrates itself every April 14, a date based on its 414 area code
Stephen Foster wrote  song about being "way down upon" this river he never saw
Booker T. Washington founded a school in this city in 1881
This river begins its nearly 900-mile course near Knoxville
Located on the Columbia River in central Washington, this city calls itself "The Apple Capital of the World"
When his name is used to describe a brandy, it usually means it's over 5 years old
The sweeter these are originally, the higher the alcoholic content of the wine will be
Kamchatka, Popov, or Mr. Boston, for example
2 products which merge in a "Seven and Seven"

1972 comedy, it's Woody Allen's only film based on a best seller

clues.text: He said, "I have never loved anyone for love's sake, except perhaps, Josephine -- a little"
1st to rule all of Britain, probably best remembered for bible translation he sponsored
1st Russian ruler to be called "czar", he annexed Siberia &, in 1580, killed his son
Longest reign ever, 94 years, was that of Pepi II, who ruled this country about 2300 B.C.
2 of 3 Arab countries currently ruled by kings

rounds.text: On this country's National Day, August 15, all 39,000 residents are invited to Vaduz Castle for festivities & drinks
